title: Situational irony: The opposite of what you think - Christopher Warner

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between a common coincidence and an ironic situation?

options.label: A
options.text: A common coincidence is always funny, while an ironic situation is never funny.

options.label: B
options.text: A common coincidence is expected to happen, while an ironic situation is unexpected.

options.label: C
options.text: A common coincidence is not ironic, while an ironic situation is always coincidental.

options.label: D
options.text: A common coincidence is always ironic, while an ironic situation is never coincidental.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the driving factor of being ironic?

options.label: A
options.text: The driving factor of being ironic is always funny.

options.label: B
options.text: The driving factor of being ironic is the exact opposite of what was expected.

options.label: C
options.text: The driving factor of being ironic is always coincidental.

options.label: D
options.text: The driving factor of being ironic is never unexpected.[Answer]: B

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a situation that is not ironic?

options.label: A
options.text: A senior citizen texting and blogging.

options.label: B
options.text: A person carrying a four-tiered wedding cake and tripping.

options.label: C
options.text: A professional cake carrier carrying a cake and still managing to trip.

options.label: D
options.text: A person winning a gold medal at the cake walking event.[Answer]: B

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a situation that is ironic?

options.label: A
options.text: A person carrying a four-tiered wedding cake and not tripping.

options.label: B
options.text: A senior citizen texting and blogging.

options.label: C
options.text: A person winning a gold medal at the cake walking event.

options.label: D
options.text: A person carrying a cake and expecting to trip.[Answer]: B

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the common expectation of older people?

options.label: A
options.text: They are always tech-savvy and connected.

options.label: B
options.text: They have a hard time turning on a computer or using technology.

options.label: C
options.text: They always have the latest smart phones.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker encouraging listeners to do?

options.label: A
options.text: To go out and find examples of common coincidences.

options.label: B
options.text: To go out and find examples of true irony in their daily lives.

options.label: C
options.text: To stay at home and avoid irony.

options.label: D
options.text: To never use the term "irony" again.[Answer]: B

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a situation where irony would be exemplified?

options.label: A
options.text: A person carrying a four-tiered wedding cake and not tripping.

options.label: B
options.text: A person carrying a four-tiered wedding cake and tripping, but they are a professional cake carrier.

options.label: C
options.text: A person carrying a four-tiered wedding cake and tripping, but they are not a professional cake carrier.

options.label: D
options.text: A person carrying a cake and expecting to trip.[Answer]: B

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main misconception of the term "irony"?

options.label: A
options.text: Many people use the term whenever they see something funny or coincidental.

options.label: B
options.text: Many people use the term whenever they see something ironic or unexpected.

options.label: C
options.text: Many people use the term whenever they see something common or expected.

options.label: D
options.text: Many people never use the term "irony" again.[Answer]: A

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's attitude towards explaining the true meaning of irony?

options.label: A
options.text: The speaker is against explaining the true meaning of irony.

options.label: B
options.text: The speaker is neutral about explaining the true meaning of irony.

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker chooses to explain the true meaning of irony.

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker never explains the true meaning of irony.[Answer]: C

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main point of understanding irony?

options.label: A
options.text: To understand the driving factor of being ironic.

options.label: B
options.text: To recognize the exact opposite of what was expected.

options.label: C
options.text: To go out and find examples of true irony in their daily lives.

options.label: D
options.text: To never use the term "irony" again.[Answer]: B
